title: SoC PERF_ST 318-1-20 Shakespeare's English Histories

instructors.instructor_addr: Annie May Swift Hall, Room G03

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
COURSE DESCRIPTION. Some of Shakespeare's earliest plays: the pious but inept reign of Henry VI; populist rebellions; the bloody Wars of the Roses; the unhappy life of Queen Margaret; and the brief rise and fall of "crookback" Richard III. At the beginning of the course, students will read and discuss the so-called first tetralogy of of Shakespeare's English history plays.

SPECIAL TOPIC AND PERFORMANCE, SPRING 2017. Students will rehearse and perform an original script by SoC senior Matthew Bentley, which adapts Shakespeare's Henry VI and Richard III into a single-evening performance. the new script will receive a workshop performance, directed by Bentley, to be presented in the Annie May Swift "Krause" Studio during early June 2017. PLEASE NOTE: The course will require flexibility scheduled outside of class rehearsal in April and May (schedule tba).

THEATRE CREDIT. This course satisfies one unit of the "History, Literature, and Criticism" requirement in the Theatre Department.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Permission of instructor. AVAILABLE DURING SOC PRE-REGISTRATION WEEK. E-mail Paul Edwards at edwdoyle@northwestern.edu or edwdoyle1@gmail.com. Students from departments outside of Communication are welcome.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Participation in a final group performance, to take place in the final week of classes at the end of fall quarter. Response papers documenting development of the script. Attendance is mandatory.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Shakespeare, HENRY VI, Parts 1-3
Shakespeare, RICHARD III
Selected corollary readings and viewings.
